com.topcoder.security.authenticationfactory
Class AuthenticateException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.topcoder.util.errorhandling.BaseException
              com.topcoder.security.authenticationfactory.AuthenticateException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AuthenticateException
extends com.topcoder.util.errorhandling.BaseException

AuthenticateException is thrown from the Authenticator's authenticate method if some unexpected errors occur during the authentication. It is used to encapsulate the exception thrown from the underlying authentication implementation, such as the network fails for the http authentication.

Version:
2.0
Author:
TCSDESIGNER, TCSDEVELOPER
See Also:

AuthenticateException

public AuthenticateException(java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.Throwable cause)

Create an AuthenticateException with error message and inner cause.

Parameters:
message - The String with the exception message.
cause - The Throwable with the cause. The cause is the exception that led to this exception being thrown.
